clauses.body_md:
# MUTUAL NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT

This Mutual Non-Disclosure Agreement (this "**Agreement**") is made on {{effective_date}} (the "**Effective Date**") by and between:

**{{party1_name}}**, a company incorporated in {{party1_jurisdiction}}, with its registered office at {{party1_address}} ("**Party 1**"); and

**{{party2_name}}**, a company incorporated in {{party2_jurisdiction}}, with its registered office at {{party2_address}} ("**Party 2**").

Party 1 and Party 2 are each referred to individually as a "**Party**" and collectively as the "**Parties**".

**IMPORTANT**: Each Party confirms that it has authority to enter into this Agreement and that the person signing has been duly authorised to do so.

During the term of this Agreement and for a period of {{non_solicit_period_months}} months thereafter, neither Party shall, directly or indirectly, solicit, recruit, or employ any employee, worker, consultant, or contractor of the other Party who was identified or became known to the soliciting Party as a result of discussions or information disclosed under this Agreement, without the prior written consent of the other Party.

This restriction shall not apply to: (a) general solicitations not specifically targeted at the other Party's personnel, or (b) individuals who independently contact the soliciting Party without any direct or indirect solicitation.

**Note**: This clause is subject to the restrictions on post-termination restraints under English common law and must be reasonable in scope, duration, and geographic extent to be enforceable.

clauses.title: {{order_remedies}}. REMEDIES
clauses.body_md:
**{{order_remedies}}.1 Injunctive Relief.** The Receiving Party acknowledges and agrees that any breach or threatened breach of this Agreement may cause irreparable harm to the Disclosing Party for which monetary damages would be an inadequate remedy. Accordingly, the Disclosing Party shall be entitled to seek equitable relief, including an injunction and specific performance, in accordance with the principles established in *Attorney-General v Blake* [2001] 1 AC 268 and related case law, in addition to all other remedies available at law or in equity.

**{{order_remedies}}.2 Cumulative Remedies.** The rights and remedies provided in this Agreement are cumulative and are in addition to any other rights and remedies available at law, in equity, or by statute.

metadata.compliance_notes: Adapted for English law. Key considerations: (1) Non-solicitation clauses must be reasonable under restraint of trade doctrine; (2) Injunctive relief governed by equitable principles; (3) Use 'made' instead of 'entered into'; (4) 'Registered office' instead of 'principal place of business'; (5) Authority confirmation recommended under Companies Act 2006.
statutory_references: Contract law (restraint of trade doctrine for non-solicitation)
Attorney-General v Blake [2001] 1 AC 268 (injunctive relief principles)
metadata.practice_notes: Under English law, non-solicitation clauses will be scrutinized for reasonableness. Consider limiting to senior employees or those with whom the party had direct contact. Confidentiality obligations are generally enforceable if the information truly is confidential and the restrictions are reasonable.
